column9: The staff were great! Informative and friendly. Any issues regarding the room were attended immediately

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Limited bathrooms for a hostel of around 30+ people. You really have to wake up early or wait for an hour just to use the toilet/ take a bath
column9: Beds are comfy and clean. The overall aesthetics of the place is wonderful too. Staff are very accommodating and will guide you through the check-in and check-out process.

column6: “The hostel was clean, staff was responsive to requests.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Breakfast was very basic. The female dorm room had very little room to walk or place large luggage. The top bunks are open on top, so when the lights turn on in the morning it will wake you up early.
column9: The hostel was clean, staff was responsive to requests. Beds had curtains, outlets and lights.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8:
The place was booked up when we were there, and they didn't have enough bathrooms. There was only 1 bathroom in the dorm room for 14 people, and 1 additional bathroom in the walkway. With so many people using the limited bathrooms, you have to wait for your turn and it gets dirty pretty quickly.
The breakfast area is small with limited seating.
column9:
My husband and I chose the Queen bed in Mixed dorm. The mixed dorm room had 4 queen beds, and 6 single beds. The room was quite spacious, so it didn't feel cramped even with 16 people in it. Bed is clean and comfortable.
The staff there are great and helpful. Breakfast is simple (cereal, milk, toast, fruits). Location is pretty convenient with MRT stations about 10 mins walk away. It's about 5 mins walk away from Tekka Center, which is where you can eat lots of yummy and cheap local food. Definitely would recommend 7 Wonders!

column6: “Good airconditioner, clean bathroom and good assistance from...”
column7: ['• Business trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Uncomfortable for elderly people to climb up the bed,before allocating a bed, you should consider the age of the person and give the lower deck and upper for the young ones.
column9: Good airconditioner, clean bathroom and good assistance from the staff on locations where to go. Simple breakfast is fresh.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Can consider to make out a small area around the basin for us to put our little stuff ( toothpaste toothbrush face cleaner) when we need to brush our teeth clean our face in the morning
column9: It s a great location

column6: “The bed was super comfy with 4 pillows and a duvet for every...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: There was just one bathroom in the room for 20 people and it was very small and a little bit dirty sometimes. The kitchen was too small for too many people.
column9: The bed was super comfy with 4 pillows and a duvet for every double bed. The people were very respectful in the room, it was not noisy at all. The staff was super friendly and let us to keep our bags all day after the check-out and even have a shower. They help you with everything.

column6: “Good budget option for travelling in Singapore overall”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night']
column8:
No remote control for air conditioning in the room, only staff have it. Someone in the room asked staff to set the temperature very low while others already caught cold, I wasn't able to sleep tight overnight and kept waking up due to freezing cold (staff wasn't around 11pm till 7am) and people snored loudly (which wasn't hostel's problem). 
The socket at my bedside had poor contact, wasn't able to use it to charge my phone, had to using the shared socket in the middle of the room to charge, didn't feel safe to leave it there overnight. The hostel is next to a street, so a bit noisy until 11pm. I was a bit worried about the beep from the door, but it's actually okay, I didn't find it really interrupting.
column9: Friendly and helpful staff, easy to check in and out. There's hot drinking water and a fridge in shared public area. In the bedroom there's a reading light and a socket at bedside, very convenient to use. The location of the hostel is close to Little India MRT station, with Tekka Centre nearly to buy fresh fruits and street food. It also has a shared bathroom outside of the room.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Few things as they dont have microwave, rooms are quite small if you are getting the Sahara category especially as they provide this room category to solo travellers or max 2 people.
column9: My stay was good here, it is value for money actually, Mainly Cassandra (Aka pikachu ) was very efficient towards her work, she will help you whatever if possible and she can do for there guest. Very happy with there services.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
Small light kept on all night in rooms, if you're sensible to it might have to bring a mask or something
Shower might be cleaned a bit more often
Vey minimal breakfast made of toast, spreads and oranges but I guess okay for the price :)
column9:
Friendly staff
Very nice location right next to very cheap Indian food center and heart of little India, also close to metro station
Many bars and restaurants around
Comfy bed

column6: “Overall great experience, would definitely recommend to those on a backpackers budget.”
column7: ['• Business trip', '• Family with young children', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The breakfast area is a bit crowded. And please serve better coffee even if it’s just 3in1.
column9: Beds were very clean and comfortable. Cooling room throughout the day. Best part was the bathroom in the female dorm room. Close to mustafa centre and city square mall. Loved it!

column6: “Beware of the toilets, they are all not the same as picture”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 6 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Picture of the toilets are in two separate rooms. So if you get unlucky and don't get any of those rooms, you will get a far dirtier and smaller toilet.
column9: 2 of the staffs were very nice and the wifi was not bad.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The morning breakfast was a little squishy for space, but its complimentary so its worth it :)
column9: Staff were very helpful, with travelling, questions, recommendations, and even helped me to change my phone sim. Beds were super comfy, and the location is very close to two MRT stations which get you wherever you need.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
It would have been better if check in was before 3pm. We had been up since 4am to get a flight to Singapore and was clearly unwell and yet I was told I hate to wait until 3pm.
The dorm room was also for 14 people which is just a bit excessive really so we didn’t get a good night sleep because there is too much disturbance with this many people.
They have made the best of what there is of a common area but it is not a comfortable experience, only high chairs to perch on in a cramped area where people are coming in and out of all the time.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Not enough toilets/showers. 1 bathroom in each 12 bed dorm and only 4 more in the whole hostel.
column9: The staff were amazing. The rooms were big, didn’t feel like there was 12 people in there. Always clean. Breakfast was fresh. Really close walk to little India metro station to get anywhere in Singapore. Good air conditioning in the room. So cheap compared to the rest of Singapore. Would definitely stay again.

column6: “1. Bed is comfortable which is every bed provided with one...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Family Room of 8', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8:
1. The space quite small and cramp. So it is not really have enough space for those who bring luggage. Then, need to take turn to had breakfast since the pantry is not big. But it is ok since they also got few chairs at in front of room other than in the pantry.
2. It is quite far from Little India MRT Station for those who bring heavy backpack/luggage. But not more than 10 minutes walking distance from Little India MRT Station.
column9:
1. Bed is comfortable which is every bed provided with one socket and bed light.
2. I like it we had private bathroom since I've booked family room for 8 pax.
3. Even though the breakfast is simple (ie fruit, bread, cereal, coffee & tea) but the smell of toast bread was so tempted and delicious HAHAHA.
4. Room is clean. They provided towel for every bed and also got shower cream.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 6 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Pantry was a bit cramped with people but the foods were very sufficient. Besides, there was no elevator so ask the staff to help you carry your heavy luggage just in case.
column9: Bathroom was spacious, there's laundry facilities for a fee, nice breakfast, friendly staffs and fast wifi connection.

column6: “Awesome location with great selection of choices for...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night']
column8: The rooms didn't have much floor space so if you have larger suitcases or backpacks they won't fit in the lockers under the bed and will take up quite a bit of space.

column8: Not enough showers and toilets. It wasn‘t really clean in the room. The room was very smelly and had no daylight at all. Also it was small af. There wasn‘t enough Space to put the Backpack beside the Bed. There are curtains on the beda but their are really old, broken and not helpful at all. I booked this Hostel with breakfast bcz I knew that Singapore is a very expensive city. But when I arrived I wouldn‘t get any breakfast because they changed it to some date in July. Even if u booked breakfast  and payed the same price! They do have a laundry service. To bad, that they told me 3 days, they would do it „tomorrow“ bcz they have so much to do. Then don‘t offer laundry service. I ended up paying much more a few houses away. Never saw someone cleaning the room, only the Bath and floor and I stayed 5 Nights. I am not that picky, I am traveling a lot solo with my backpack and sleeping always in Hostels but that was under  jail-level. Sorry.

column8:
The air-con is regulated, it means that at 9a.m. they cut it and trust me it wakes you up very quickly!
It is SO noisy, choirs singing quite loud in the rooms at 9a.m., people downstairs screaming, many kids in holidays I guess.
The toilets are always wet, they think that by showering the toilets it washes them but guess what? it doesn't. I had to wipe poop off the toilet seat.
The lockers are small as well, you can't put a big bag in there and we are backpackers.. They make you pay for your towel as well.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Bed in 18-Beds Mixed Dorm Room', '• Stayed 6 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
RESTROOM - This was my biggest disappointment with the place. The restroom was disgusting. There were only two restrooms for the whole building; 4 toilets in all for the men and 2 showers. The restrooms didn't look like they were cleaned regularly. The toilet cubicle was so small that you couldn't move around. The shower area was rather suffocating too, and there was nowhere to hang your clothes. The floor was always wet and almost flooded. They didn't even provide soap in the sink. Totally disgusting.
BEDROOM - The bedrooms were crowded. The bed was okay in size and felt comfortable, though it looked like it lacked cleaning. Again, housekeeping was not present. The lockers were small and dirty.
STAFF - The reception was supposed to be open from 8:30 until 22:30, but the staff didn't arrive on time and left too early. Vivien was okay, but the others weren't. The one in the housekeeping didn't even answer me nor looked at me when I asked for something; she just pointed. Extremely rude. They didn't care for their customers either. The check-in time was 3 p.m., and while other hostels would accommodate early check-in when beds are available, they didn't start cleaning the rooms until almost 3 p.m. The tired travellers were left trying to sleep in the cramped couches in the lobby.
column9:
LOCATION - It's really near the Rochor MRT station, so travelling was very convenient. A 7-11 was also present nearby, as well as malls and stores.
BREAKFAST - Breakfast was just toast and jam with coffee and tea, although the bread was a lot. They no longer offer free breakfast now, though.

column6: “The people staying there re all very warm and friendly.”

I had to argued and finally she agreed with an earlier advising me to rebook and cancel my earlier bookings ....what a full of crap
Aircond re off few times in 24 hours ,that made the dormitory very stuffy n too hot to sleep , especially during day time...
No indoor laundry service and outside the coins operated that 10mins walking distance re old machine s

column8: First to begin with, Booking.com charged me 88 Singapore dollars. On the counter was a sticker that it normally costs 25 Singapore dollars. When I asked the staff why there is a difference they said because your booking was via Booking.com. This really made me mad, but I had no other alternative because it was already late. I don’t expect much from a Hostel, but the bathroom was full with hair and was not cleaned by at least a week. Definitely not recommending this Hostel.

column8: The price stated on Booking.com is SGD 40 but when I check-in, it's SGD 44 excluding deposit. Also, I have to change my bed 2 times. During the first time, the bed assigned to me wasn't clean and it's actually occupied. Then on the next day, when I got back to the hostel, the staff told me that there are a few guys checking-in to the female dormitory room along with their girl friends and did not want to leave. So I changed my bed once again. It's not actually the staff's fault but it is definitely not a really good experience.

column9: The lobby area was great, the staff were very nice and cooperative—they help you out whenever you need any assistance, you get to meet a lot of people from around the world, the facilities are of good value (toilets, dining area, etc.). Go for it!!

column8: I'm​ not​ a​ picky person​ and​ I​ didn’t​ write​ comment​ on​ Booking.com​ much.​ The​ common​ room​ is​ very​ small​ and​ smelly.​ The​ bedroom​ was​ worst, AC was​ working​ 18​ degree​ but​ the​ temperature was​ hot.​ I​ told​ the​ reception​ist​ but​ she​ didn’t​ care​ about​ it.​ Bathroom​s, walking​ ways​ and​ kitchen​ were​ dirty.​ It's​ not​ value money​ any more.​ I'm​ ok​ to​ sleep​ in​ the​ dorm but​ I'm​ not​ ok​ with​ AC.​ I​ needed​ to​ change​ the​ hostel​ at​ that​ night.​ I​ suggest​ you​ to​ sleep​ at​ 'Brunc​ Hostel'​ which​ is​ the​ same​ cost​ but​ it's​ better, near​ metro, clean​bedroom, lift, big​ common​ room, free​ WiFi,​ space​ for​ drying​ clothes, not​ smelly​ as​ Campbell​ Inn, good​ air​ condition​ and​ value​ what​ you​ pay.​

column8: Stayed there for 2 nights.The first night went well.The 2nd was terrible.I woke up at 2am hearing a guy voice in our room.By the way,the room I booked is only for female.I was shocked.I don't mind if he get in the room just for a while but he stayed till morning.The girl that brought him there and him did some dirty deeds on the bed just below my bed.How do you feel if you were me?I can't sleep when the bed is rocking back and forth like crazy.They only stop when I switch on the bed lamp.I waited till the guy left but he stayed till morning,sleeping fine and snoring loud.Other people that stayed in the same room only wake up when they heard the guy snoring.I told the reception guy about the matter.He fixed the problem immediately.The girl didn't even say sorry to us.
column9: The bed was comfy.Breakfast was nice(bread&cornflakes).Thank you for the reception guy,for fixing the problem so quickly.I don't know how but please increase the security of the place.

column8: Small rooms. No aircon in the bathroom, as soon as you turn off the water in the shower you start sweating. Hence a lot of mould in the bathroom... The charge a "booking.com fee", so you have to pay more.

column6: “The lower bunk beds had curtains so it gave me a sense of...”
column7: ['• Business trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Bed in 12-Bed Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 13 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
The staff rarely changed the bedsheets for new comers to the room, my sheets were not changed when i was assigned to my bunk bed. When the old roomies left and new ones came it, they too slept on old used bedsheets.
Men and women are given separate bathrooms which is great! Unfortunately it was terribly maintained. There are three sinks and two of the sinks are clogged with gross water, ppl had to line up just to brush their teeth. The showers are good but there are hundreds of FRUIT FLIES ALL OVER THE WALLS of the showers and the soap dish, it was so disgusting. Male and female have separate bathrooms and i have occasionally found men using the female toilets, i had complined to the staff but nothing much was done about it. A guy even came in and opened my bathroom door while i was in the shower at night! There are cctv everywhere but i wonder if they use it to find the guys who keep using the female toilets. I have no clue. No updates whatsoever. The bathrooms have no windows and only a small ventilator which makes the whole bathroom wet and stuffy, so we are forced to open the front door which allows men to come in whenever they want.
This place needs new cleaners. It was unhygienic.
They either need to make an actual window for the toilets so the front doors can be closed or they need to allocate male and female bathrooms on different levels. This current set up is terrible and unsafe for female visitors.
column9:
The lower bunk beds had curtains so it gave me a sense of privacy.
There were always toilet paper and the internet was better than most places. Though sometimes wifi was totally unavailable.

column8: Staff are rude. I came with my partner and booked a mixed room. As I confronted the rudeness on the first day, Anne( or so she said her name was which on another occasion she said that the manager was Anne and then refuted it) seemed to have complained that I am with “girls” and should be shifted. Next morning the manager came and rudely called me out of the room and tried to put me in another room. When firmly told off the manager (or whom they said was the manager) apologized but went to the common area and very inappropriately said that I liked to be with women. This is extremely offensive for me and my partner. When requested to talk to the manager to discuss an early check out the manager put the receptionist forward and refused to discuss. Be warned not to pay in advance as I did.

column8: The 18 bed mixed dorm was jam packed. No room for bags. There were lockers but you felt very much on top of everyone and the only space you had was your bed. No curtains so no privacy. The air con was not very good and was turned off at night. There were only 2 showers and 2 toilets between 3 rooms, with mine being 18 I’m guessing the total was about 35 sharing the showers/toilets. Breakfast is bread, jam and milk but not much room to move around and make your own. Also the least social hostel I’ve ever stayed in, no one spoke to each other 🙁

column7: ['• Solo traveller', '• Bed in 18-Beds Mixed Dorm Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
I’ve been traveling a lot all over the world and this is actually one of the worst hostel I’ve ever stayed at (considering what they promise in their booking.com ad and what you pay). First of all, they say that there is WiFi. This is not true. Stayed here for several days and WiFi worked maybe one time out of ten. And when it worked it was extremely slow. Why promise WiFi when it’s not true? Second, the people working here leave the hostel at 11 pm, so not 24 h reception. One time I told them before they went home for the day that there was no toiletpaper in any of the two toilets that more than 50 (yes 50) people share together (disgusting toilets too), and THEY DID NOT refill the toilet paper until the next day, almost 12 hours later. Imagine how the toilets smelled and what they looked like.. Thirdly, it smelled as if there was a dead animal in the dorm that we were sleeping in, AND the rooms are extremely small so you basically sleep just right next to the person in the other bed (you can just reach out and touch a random person - or a random person can touch you). Fourth, the laundry is crazy expensive. Fifth, when I arrive they didn’t even show me were the washroom was, nor did I get a lower bed (I have a knee injury) even though saying to the staff that it’s extremely painful for me to climb up to the upper bed. Sixth, there are sooo many people staying in a very very small area, they are just trying to fit in as many beds as possible on a very small area and with as little of staff as possible. 
All in all - do not stay here!
column9: Staff was trying to be nice. This was the o my positive part of this stay.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Bed in 18-Beds Mixed Dorm Room', '• Stayed 1 night']

Next to it they were really dirty, no fresh air, so ferry humid and hot.
The beds are ok, but room itself definitely not clean.
column9: Room was a good temperature, public area was alright.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Bed in 18-Beds Mixed Dorm Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
The staff doesn’t seem to have a clue how to check me in, the common
table are always crowded not by guest But by residents. I got chased
away by these residents from the common table because they want to have
a 10pm dinner 🙄 not power outlets on the wall for a room of 12 people,
just wow. Internet non-existent. I tried to check out on 7:30 and get my
key refund and got rejected because the staff don’t come to work till
8:30. So, I don’t get my key deposit back as I am rushing to the
airport. Toilet is awfully small, dirty and littered with used soap. For
$5 extra or less I have stayed in wayyyyyy better backpackers inn in
Singapore, Malaysia, Cambodia and Vietnam. Please guys, just stay away
from this den of hell.
column9: None

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• 2 Beds in 8-Beds Mixed Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8: The lady that works there in the morning is horrible, she can barely talk, she doesn't understand a thing and she's so slow. The showers downstairs are way to small, can barely turn around. The toilets are always dirty (might be because of the many Indian travellers as well). Breakfast was not to bad for the price, but on Sunday they forgot to serve it.. Can you imagine? We couldn't even checkout before 8.30 on Sunday since we had to leave early and they still had our 10$ deposit.

column6: “1. There were many small food shops/restaurants near our...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Bed in 6-Bed Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
1. The bunk bed i was using, theres this loud squeaking sound whenever i move because the spring is broken or something.
2. I dont think they clean the room on a regular basis becuase i saw a dead cockroach on the floor.
3. The bed sheet, pillow case and blanket doesnt look clean, probably it is but since its so old or been washed gazillion of times, the color faded.
4. There are 2 toilet and bath shared by 6 people in the room that needs improvement. Theres no bidet and its so small, you can barely move while youre in there.
5. Breakfast is also disappointing, they only offer bread, coffee and tea. They have 4 kinds of sandwich spread which i didnt try, i just had my bread toasted and coffee that day.
6. The room looks so different from the picture shown in the website, its misleading.
column9:
1. There were many small food shops/restaurants near our hostel that offers indian and chinese cuisines.
2. Near 2 subway stations. (I forgot the names, if I remember it correctly, Rochor and Jelan Basar stations)
3. Theres a local convenience store, few steps away from the hostel also 7-eleven, about 100m away. 
4. The filipina receptionist is very nice, warm, welcoming and smiling when we came in.
5. Our Lady of Lourdes Catholic Church is less than a kilometer walk from this hostel.

Bed was bowed so the spot where my matress is, was just a crater that my spine woke up, invaded my dreams and proceeded to bash my head with my own dream spine. column6: “You get what you pay for; best to just stay one night max. Pay more and find someplace else.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Bed in 14-Bed Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 4 nights']
column8:
Everything else is quite disappointing and quite disgusting - nothing like the pictures shown. I stayed there for 4 nights and it was a mistake. 
I stayed in the Attic storey, which was on the 3rd floor. The room is divided into two, so each half shares a bathroom. My half consisted of 6 beds, two fans, and a half-decent air conditioner.
Here are a few major things to complain about: 
SPACE - Not much place for you to put your things in such a small space; just a small shelf and a couple hooks if they aren't broken. I ended up hanging my wet towel and sweaty clothes on my bed frame and posts. I highly recommend renting a locker to be safe from pests and theft.
PESTS - On the last night, I found that there is a pretty serious rat infestation. My backpack was gnawed through by rats. I found out that they were actually attacking my bag and made a gaping hole, I threw the snacks into the waste bin, which they then later started attacking. At least five or more fought over the food all night long. I brought it up to the front desk (who I'm guessing is the owner/manager) when I checked out in the morning that there was a pest problem. He just smiled at me and said nothing because there were other people who came in to check in. I uploaded a photo of my eaten bag. 
CLEANLINESS - Given that there is a major rat problem here, you should be careful everywhere. Don't walk barefeet. Fortunately, the sheets, pillows, and blanket looked and smelled clean. The bathroom was "cleaned" every two days. There were used bottles on the floor the whole time I stayed there. Not much space to put your belongings to avoid getting soaked. There is a huge musty smell throughout the place from the lack of ventilation. 
SIMCARD - The hostel says they would provide a simcard to use during your stay. They didn't receive any new simcards and the existing ones were expired.
column9: Location is pretty central, so it's convenient for travel. The main value is the price for the location you're in.

column9:
Many things,  The behavior of the reception girl her name is Jona,  she is so humble and extremely helpful, whenever i go to her with a query she tries to resolve it immediately, she didn't even charged me for few printouts as its chargeble. She is so friendly that i didn't felt like talking to a stranger from my first day to my last day. Cleaning is super duper awesome cleaner name is Andy, i haven't seen someone so humble in my entire life and perfect meanwhile... He is perfect in his work... He have given us pastries and many baked things as his part time job is in a bakery shop... He use to come at 11am in our room clean the entire thing properly and goes...  
Jona and Andy are the only reason staying in that hostel for long period.
Hostel is super clean and resonable on the other side.

column9:
Value for money. This is a hostel. Guests should expect very basic facilities and amenities. Breakfast is plain sliced bread with a selection of spread (peanut butter, margarine, strawberry jam.) Have bread toaster and microwave. Have supply of coffee and chocolate drink and tea. Breakfast time is 7-11am.
Guest should be prepared to bring their own towels or pay minimal amount to rent towels. There are no bathroom supplies so guests should bring own shampoo, conditioner, soap and other needs.
Staff is friendly esp. the Filipina gal.

column6: “It was an enjoyable stay with our family at Kawan Hostel with Indian restos around.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Family Room (6 Adults) with Private Bathroom', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: It was only the airconditioning unit that was not functioning well.  I think, it needs cleaning or maintenance. So, we felt humid.
column9: I like the location. It's accessible to transportation/MRT and restaurants. And I enjoy little India's chain of jewelry stores where I was able to buy. The price was just reasonable. I wanna come back and shop for more. :) I love jewelries! I also shopped for some souvenir items at the China Town where we also had dinner. We ate our favorite dimsum/ chinese dishes and not to forget the oyster omelet. I love the indian food (Briyani Rice) served in Indian Restaurants around Kawan Hostel where it was my 1st time to eat. Don't forget to taste their home made coffee. It is served hot or with ice. So yummy! I so love it being a coffee addict. :)) Prices of food were just reasonable.  Lastly, I really appreciate the girl who was at the front desk in Kawan Hostel for the effort in giving us the directions/ location of Catholic Churches found near since it was Sunday and our family wanted to hear mass.

The location was excellent as it was close to two MRT stations.
We booked a 13 seater shuttle bus from the airport through the property (60S$).
You could buy discounted attraction tickets at reception.
You could also buy cold drinks at the reception.
You could help yourself to coffee & toast in the morning, so don't buy including breakfast as it's free anyway.
Three's a great restaurant just up the road called the Countryside cafe.

column8:
1. The room is too small. In single room there is no table and no place to keep clothing/staff (other than a very small place to keep hangers).

3. There should be secured/locker or store room to keep the luggage after check out (for boarders catching flights in the afternoon/evening).
column9: The location is fine. The staffs are helpful.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
Firstly, the location of arianna hotel is inconvenient. my gf and i had to walk so far (approx 15mins) from farrer park mrt to the hotel. 
Secondly, the lobby, lift and corridor had a bad smell for some reason. 
Thirdly, the level was like a maze. We had to make turns numerous times to reach our room. 
Forthly, my gf and i were really disappointed when we entered our room because it looked run-down and old.
Room and bed sheets were unclean. Bed sheets had dirty and black spots. Towels had stains. Room was super cramped. Shower head was loose like it was gonna break anytime and they didnt bother to fix it. Dirty bathroom. 
There were 2 of us but they provided us with 1 cup only. kettle was dusty and rusty.... 
We paid SGD494 for 2 nights and it didnt worth our money. We understand that we booked the hotel during peak period so it was more expensive but the main point is, we paid so much but it was such a waste of our money...... it was an uncomfortable experience. 
Customer service was alright. 
Overall, arianna hotel is the worst hotel we’ve ever stayed. Even Hotel 81, a budget hotel is so much better.  Unfortunately, we forgot to take pics of the room. 
Hopefully they would get the shower head fixed, make some effort to clean up the room, ensure that the bed sheets, towels and blankets are clean. Hygiene is priority and it affects guests’ experience.
column9: There is literally NOTHING i like about this hotel. #sorrynotsorry

column8: Moldy. Even the pillow was moldy. Smell was horrible. The water kettle was not clean, after some other guest had made coffee in it. Electrical switchboard kept beeping EVERY 5 SECONDS the whole night! Trash in a heap in the corridor by the elevator on every floor. Hard to find the front door from the street. Rooms are tiny, especially the single rooms. Could not have my bag lying down on the floor if I also wanted to be able to open the door. The bathroom was basically a sink with a toilet underneath and a shower above. Bag room is a shelf in the lobby that anyone has access to.
column9:
Really nice staff. Gave me a bigger room free of extra charge on the night that I arrived, because I was sick, which was great of them. Helped me change room to a smaller one early in the morning, although check-in is normally after lunch. Very helpful with directions etc.
Ok location for a cheap hotel.

column6: “On the first day, it was a disaster!”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 5 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
On the first day, it was a disaster! Arianna couldn't find my payment and the receptionist said that we were not paid for the room. However, a week before the actual date of stay, Arianna charged my card. So, we paid again through cash at the front desk. Then a day after, they found my payment and they said that they voided it and said that the money was being returned. I coordinated with my card issuer, until now there is no funds being credited to my account. 
I know, probably this was not a human error but I suggest that there should be a consideration given since we had a proof that the hotel charged us already for the five-day stay. They should have returned the cash payment instead of the card payment. 
Any how, we hotel is very good. Staff was good, the place of the hotel is near the train station and the facility is great.
Thank you for accommodating us!
Thank you,
Mel Anthony Fernandez

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']

The hotel is fine, the staff is nice and treat us well, no issue with payment (we booked tru booking.com), the room is big enough for 3 of us, the bed is comfort, got towel and kettle in the room. We also can request iron at the counter. Overall, it is a pleasant stay for us. Will definitely choose again if come back to SG

column8:
I always heard about "photos could be deceiving" and after being at Arianna Hotel, now it proved.
The rooms are not as how its being advertised on booking.com.
Its always said that your first impression is the last. When I arrived at the reception desk, the staff was so grumpy.
Being from a country where tourism and hospitality is at its best, it was disheartening to see how someone could be so rude to customers.
Being a property listed on booking.com , I'll make a plea to one of the representatives from Booking.com to make a visit to the property and review it thoroughly.

column7: ['• Business trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 5 nights']
column8: Room check out procedure. They did not return me at least 2 days rent out of 4 days.
column9: I did not pay before arrival in hotel before 28 August/2018 but the hotel authority silently blocked my credit card without my opinion. I got a message in E mail from bank that I had done transaction of 268 USD on 22 august. But at that time i was not in my country rather I was in Thailand. So the authority blackmailed me and when i reached the hotel the took credit card payment through my signature. The room was too small(321 No room) to accommodate an even lean and thin person. So on the 2nd day I asked the authority to leave the room and return me at least 2 days rent from next 4 days rent as i paid for 5 days. But they were so rude and non cooperate and  refused to get back me any money. They claimed that it was non refundable booking. I was in the hotel only for one night although it was booked for 5 nights up to 2 sept/18. I left the hotel on the 3rd day with a deep breath of fluttering. Money is not a problem but attitude of the hotel Ariana was very bad bad and bad.

Truth is you get what you pay for

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• 2 rooms', '• Stayed 5 nights']
column8: AC conditioner control is locked.
column9:
Great Location. for Indian non english speakers, can reach hotel easily and safely, 3 MRTs around,
Just opposite mustafa mall. Lot of indian food restaurants. and budget friendly.
We have actually walked to Bugis Street, it is just 1KM.
We are 6 adults and 4 children, stayed for 5 days.  Stroller for rent is available. it is 5 SGD per day. 
I have read other reviews, but i didn't find any discomfort, rooms are cleaned daily, air vents are there. no smell. 
It is excellent choice for budget friendly hotel. There might be cheaper option available which are away from public transport and food, where you will waste money for taxi. 
Staying in prominent location cuts lot of unexpected expenses.

column8: I booked this hotel from 15/6/18 to 22/6/18 with information I gave you on booking form to say I arrived in early morning at 2 am on 16/6/18 but room payed for from 15/6/18 and when I arrived with my family on 16/6/18 at 2am I was told no room for me and I could check in at 2pm and receptionist so abnoxious in all my travels to many hotels I never encountered such a ignorant man and no effort to help us in anyway, the police where even called and this man is a real credit to your hotel as to what to expect I had to walk around strange city to look for hotel at 3am in the morning finally getting room in hotel costing me 80 dollars for small room for 8 hours, and also this receptionist promised on front of police officer that boss of Ariana would meet me at 9am on 16th June 18 to sort out my difficulty’s But I there and no one from hotel turn up more lies from staff this man, got to talk to Douglas from Phoenix Arizona who sounded like he did not want to listen to my problem and kept telling me to relax with the night I just had I think that was right thing for him to say, now I asked hotel and booking dot com to send Ed my booking form but still have not seen this and my right as to have freedom of information and see did I make mistake or your hotel error so please show me this booking form ask need to see if my error or yours, if mine I apologise sincerely to your hotel and booking .com if your mistake I think you need to refund me my 80 dollars and make some apology to my wife and family as this was to be a happy holiday ruined by someone’s error hope your hotel and booking.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The building needs renovation, no doubt. Dirty wall and floor. The first room I got (420, watch out!) was so moldy, I had to sleep with an open door because of the smell. Tried to ask the receptionist to give me another room, because it’s not just simply unpleasant but dangerous healthwise, he said he can only sort it out on the following day. The wall was actually so wet for no particular reason, you could see water drops. The night after I got moved to another room, which still didn’t look great, but at least it had a window, was relatively spacious compared to the previous one, however I woke up in the middle of the night because of some noise caused by a 3 inches big cockroach having fun around. The receptionists didn’t seem to be too helpful, mostly didn’t even bother to let me finish my sentence, and once when I asked for advise in connection with transport I felt if I would have asked for a favour. Not to mention that I got recommended to get a taxi for $25, however Uber cost $15, if he would have had the patience to explain public transport, could cost possibly like $5. I know it’s a good price for accommodation in an expensive city, but I think hygiene and kindness are not supposed to be luxury.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• 2 rooms', '• Stayed 7 nights']
column8:
The room are tiny and not close to the picture description. My family had cockroaches, flukes hookwarms and pinworms etc. and I am not bluffing, I have pictures. I tried calling them but they came in once and didn't bother the next time. The bathroom was too small and the doorknobs were the worst. It barely locked plus the window was always looked, couldn't open to dry clothes. Since it was a seasonal time therefore couldnt shift and hated to return to the hotel everytime. I forbid you or anyone to visit there, frankly I sometimes feared that the yucky bugs would creep into my bed and seeing no other options, me and my wife had to kill them if not we food have have serious threat to life and even consumed to ill health and god knows what. 
I would request booking.com to never take them in the team if possible try to upgrade their details if not it will ruin your credibility as I have used you for my Malaysia and Thailand trip! If possible, I would like to share photos of my room and insects with you. Lastly, I would request Arianna staffs to take this seriously if not the competition is going to eat you alive.
Never coming back in their!

column9: I paid SG$180 for 3nights so im expecting for a little nicer and cleaner one. Theres a cockroach in my room and the water heater for coffee is very dirty. I had a flu so i went hotel early to rest. I take medicine and fall asleep. The phone rang i did not answer it coz im not expecting for a call. After around 10 mins and it rang again so i answered it and they want me to transfer to another room as per the guy i booked a single room. Cant understand coz i have slept already with that room for 2 nyts. In told them im not feeling well but the receptionist a chinese or maybe singaporean look alike and he told me i have to transfer. I have no other choice but to do what he is asking. These is my very bad experience with Arianna Hotel. Indian staff are kind.

column6: “Too scary to stay , we moved out the second night”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
First , we were doubly charged by the hotel as the impolite receptionist claimed that the booking name was different with the credit card name . We had to pay AGAIN . The hotel promised to make a refund on October 24, 2017 with a bank prove .Yet, we still havent received any , even after the frequent negotiations with the hotel through booking.com 
Second ,  pictures tell our story . Viewers can enjoy the photos attached first . We originally booked a double room at this hotel for 4D3N . As late check-in, we were upgraded and assigned to stay the first night in a triple room  ,basic and a bit old, still which was so nice of their act.
However, we had never thought of any nightmare coming up . The next day we were arranged to this double room.  We even found TWO baby COCKROACHES hanging around on the tea-table. We regretted not to take the bodies of them ...
The secured lock of the room door was broken . The knob of the bathroom couldnt function well .  
We immediately called for changing another room , the room service just told us that they run a budget hotel thats why we ended up like that . They refused to change a new room for us NOR made any compensation just because the manager was off the duty . (The staff said) 
We realized this hotel is a 2 star one or may be a budget one when we had made a reservation. HOWEVER, we have NEVER experienced such trashy stay in Singapore, marked an obvious stink in our trip . 
Besides, we met and talked to 3 staff at the hotel and none of them was patient . Their gesture and tone of speaking were very impatient  and instructive. 
Dont stay in this so-callled 2 star hotel anymore. Every thing is shabbier than a local inn or a motel.
We have made a serious complaint via booking.com but one customer servicer officer (we have spoken for at least 5 officers already )was reluctant to make a replied call to us . She claimed that emails are find .

column8: No Cleanliness. Cockroaches were there. The room did not have a window and it was emanating a musty or filthy odour.  I requested them to do something for the stingy odour. They said they can't do anything. I asked them for replacing the blankets after using it for 3 nights but they said they would not change it until my check-out date as it is a budget Hotel! I persisted a while and then they gave me another one- which was taken away from a nearby room where a guest was checking out. It was his blanket-no washing done. When I pointed out long strands of hair ( presumably a woman's hair), they took it back and said No blankets available.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Superior Double Room', '• Stayed 5 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The check in staff tried to place us in a standard room when we paid for a superior. After complaining they moved us to a superior. That room then had a broken air con so it was a sweat box for days and they assured us they would have the maintenance person come in to fix. They lied. By the 4th night we had to move in the middle of the night because the room had become so hot we could not sleep. We were then moved to a smaller room that stank of cigarettes. The staff were also quite u happy about our complaints even though they had caused it themselves. Would not recommend at all.
column9: The rooms were decently clean.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double Room without Window', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']

column9: None so far.

column7: ['• Business trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Superior Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8: Overall cleanliness level is low. Sheets are stained and have big holes, and are too small for the bed so you end up with half of your body directly on the plastic mattress. Aircon cannot be adjusted or even turned off unless you turn off the power in your room. Noisy fan in bathroom cannot be turned off. TV didn't work. Cannot open blinds - they are broken, but if you could the stained glass would provide an awful fluro green glow to the room. All communal areas smell like cigarette smoke.

column8:
First the room had windows that were locked and covered in green glass so we couldn’t get any daylight or even a view of the outside. 
Second, the bathroom didn’t have a bin, soap, hand towels, a water sprayer and most importantly the shower didn’t have a curtain so everytime we showered the bathroom was soaked with water. 
Third, the hotel is extremely overpriced for the facilities and servives they are providing (which is only a room- no swimming pool, no balcony...), it felt more like a hostel/motel than an actual hotel. 
I was lucky to spend very minimal time there
column9:

column9:
If hotel is not your destination to stay whole day, but you still need comfort, this hotel is the right one for you. The location that near to public transport (MRT is just behind this hotel), Masjid, shopping and dine area (about 10 minutes walk to bugis junction or little india).  You can also have a light breakfast (such as bread, cup noddle, tea or coffee) from the mini market just next to the hotel.

column8:
1. A staff asure to us we could do early check-in by 11am. 
->But, when we got to hotel by 11am, staff was changed and they said there's no room till 2pm( which is the official check-in time)
2.The airconditioner was't working from the first time.
-> It took 3 hours to change my room.
->They don't care about inportance of time for traveler. 
->Even they've never noticed how long would it takes. 
->Never called back to let us know how something has going on before we did.
->We just trapped in warm hotel room for that long.
3. No one apologized to us.
4. Reception was terrible. 
->especially iresponsible and rude so much.
5. Room was very durty that can't believe they've cleaned and made up before we checked in.
6. The airconditioner had been out of order everyday.
7. The alley was cooler than the room.
8. The manager said, "because hotel 81 is cheap hotel".
9. Worst service than hostel.

column6: “A little expensive with respect to the ameneties available but excellent location”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Superior Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8:
- No windows (well, windows were there, but they were fully sealed).
- Air conditioning could be adjusted according to our choice from the room.
- Since there were no windows, air was circulated by the A/C vent and the bathroom fan vent.
- Rooms were of enough size to accommodate two people, but it was smaller than what we expected for the price.
- Bed and the pillows were a little hard.
- Two free water bottles were often replenished with only one, and we had to ask for the second one every day except for one day.
- Had a slightly strong smell in the rooms probably due to the lack of fresh air but this was no problem.
column9:
- Perfectly located within a few minutes of walking distance to the MRT stations Rochor, Little India, and Jalan Besar.
- Located close to the Bugis Street where you can find many, good local eateries and places to shop.
- Supermarkets and grocery stores could be found nearby.
- Hotel staff was very helpful in helping us find our way around and also in changing our initial room since it had some strong smell.
- Housekeeping was good.
- Dental kits were provided.
- The shampoo and body wash liquid was good.
- No sound of the traffic although hotel was right beside the road.
- Everything was clean.
- Had a lift for all floors.

There is an elevator to service to higher floors. Hotel has 6 floors.
The hotel is a short 200m from MRT Rochor Exit B. 
Hotel has wheelchair access ramp and convenience store located in same building with hotel. Store opens long hours for snacks and drinks.

column9: First time experience in a budget hotel in Singapore. Not as bad as I expect, really! They also seemed interested in us and were very kind and smiley!

column7: ['• Couple', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: We arrived in Singapore very late. We had pre-booked and paid for our accommodation. When we arrived we handed the staf our passports. They asked for my husbands work permit card - My husband did not have in possession at the time. And that was that, because he did not have this card we could not stay there. They did not offer us any help or solutions. If we did not have this card we could not stay there. Staff were rude and unhelpful. 3 weeks ago we had stayed in Hotel 81 Chinatown with no issues. My husband is in Singapore every month and regularly books with Hotel 81 and has stayed many times at this particular Hotel. By the time we were able to find another hotel close by it was past 12am. The only form of ID they require was our passports (like all other Hotels). Very disappointed. Will not be staying with Hotel 81 again.

column8: Not at all. The service was overall cold. Upgraded the room to Triple Room. Upon checked in, only 2 towels provided for 3pax.  1 small bottle of mineral water to share with 3pax. 2 sachets coffee but no sugar and creamer. Tooth brush was only for 2. Probably those are complimentary items. But I expected that the hotel will provide those as normal as other hotels do since the rate is like 3 star budget hotel. I could get better rate at other hotels in Little India if I really careful during my booking. No reservation fees for the booking, but immediate charges incurred for cancellation.
column9: I regret for chosing the hotel despite it said in Little India but the place is so quiet at night and not many restaurants and shops open at night, not like Syed Alwi Street which is close to Mustafa Centre and plenty of restaurant and shops open at night.

column8:

They did not provide the in room shoes and the floor not that clean and comfortable to walk on although just a little space to walk around in room.

Can easily heard people walking by our room, sounds of close the other doors and talking on the corridor even at late night.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8:
Booking.com (or Hotel 81) could have told us that the room did not have windows before we booked the room.
Ventilation was poor in the room, and we could not detect an exhaust fan in the toilet, so most of the foul smell from the toilet remained in our room after. :(
column9:
The location was convenient (near Jalan Besar MRT station and walking distance from Rochor MRT station), but it would have been a bit more helpful to publicise that it's more convenient to use Exit B to get to Hotel 81 Dickson.
Used Exit A a few times before realising that Exit B was more convenient in terms of walkability.

column9: Great location! 3 MRT-stations within walking distance. I really love district: little India. Day or night: shops are open, people on the street. If you flight arrives early or leaves late, there is bagage storage, so you don't have to worrie about you baggage while visiting the city.

column6: “The receptions are very helpful and polite.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: There are not much complain about the place, except the price, but we understand that it was a high demand date due to F1 Grand Prix. They were happy to offer us another room when we identified a leakage.
column9: The receptions are very helpful and polite. They upgraded our room based on our request. All in all, we liked our stay in the hotel. The lines are clean, the bathroom also clean. TV was working fine.

column6: “Other than the above the rest all were good.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Superior Double Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
Although the amenities were okay for the price, I found it little bit untidy. 
On the day one I found a centipede coming out of the bathroom drain hole. And on day 4, the AC was not working through out the night till we checked out the next morning. As we were tired and as it was an odd hour we didn't report it to the receptionist.
As I was travelling with a 2 year old, the above two things annoyed me.
column9: Other than the above the rest all were good. The staff were friendly and helped us out with everything. And even the sheets were changed everyday. We could get the coffee from the opposite shop and it was really close to the MRT and Bus station.

column6: “Great location - dont stay for longer than 1 night though.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The room was incredibly moldy. I honestly believe that staying in this room for more than 1 night is unhealthy for you. There are rooms without window and rooms with window but the windows wont be able to open. The air conditioning cant be adjusted by yourself, you'll have to call reception for that (with a phone that didn't work). There were little flies everywhere. Because of the insufficient opportunities to ventilate the room, the steam of your shower (which is almost directly above the toilet) can't go anywhere.
column9: The location is very nice. It's a small 5 minute walk to the downtown line that brings you to great places. It's walking distance from haji lane and the beautiful mosque and the hotel itself is in little India with lots of restaurants and small stalls.

column6: “A great hotel for tourists who just need a place to sleep in. Comfortable, with pleasant staff”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 5 nights']
column8: The room had no windows, just huge mirrors covering two walls. When we entered, there was black hair on the floor, in the bathroom, and in that one drawer you have in the room, which threw me off. You can't control the AC, you have to call the front desk and ask them to set the temperature - which we did every day, as it was waaaay too cold for sleeping. Hot water in the shower runs for only 10 minutes after which it becomes barely warm.
column9: The location is good, only 10 minute walk to the Bugis area. It is surrounded by good restaurants, malls, and interesting buildings. The bed was comfy. The staff is very friendly, and ready to help whenever you need anything. If you are visiting Singapore as a tourist, this is a decent hotel - has all the basic amenities, including a tv and a fridge, and if you don't intend to spend your days inside, it's great. Excellent price to quality ratio for Singapore

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']

column9: Hotel was nice and clean. Value for money. staffs were helpful in arranging for pickups. we had left our baggage there which was well taken care off.

column9:

The mirrors next to the bed had condense running down, and the bathrooms had black mold. The asked for another room, and the staff was friendly enough to show us multiple, but all were the same. We got a room with a window, which was relatively dry. However, after we came back from our late dinner, the room was as humid as the others. We checked out after one night.
column9: The staff was the most enjoyable of this hotel, as they all realized this wasn’t up to standard and were very lenient on cancelling the rest of our reservation.

Staff was always busy so they couldn't give the needed attention to each guest.
column9: Situated in walking distance from MRT Rochor. Had few options for restaurants and bars nearby. Few shopping Malls.  Except the location other facilities were pretty average

Closer to many places, restaurants in Little India and its surroundings.  Sim Lim Square, Lot of South Indian restaurants, shops with affordable price nearby.  Famous Mustafa Center is  located in 10 mins walking distance :-)
Value for money, booked in booking.com.  No complaints or issues.

Room is completely basic. We paid the one to have window. Just for sunlight. No worthy view just Little India store roofs. 
Area is a completely different world than rest Singapore. 
Room was not clean enough. Dust etc around and below the bed. Ants and other small insects seem everyday in the room. 
Bathroom becomes all wet after taking a shower as there is no step to keep water. Could add some tool to push or gather the water at least. 
If you care about feeling comfortable at a hotel, i would suggest stay somewhere else and pay more.
column9: Basic offerings. Staff was ok. Baggage kept for few hours after check out. Location close at two metro stations. Good price for this city.

Tooth brushes and toilettries available.

You should definitely opt for this hotel if you are planning to stay at Little India.

What we liked the most was how we were allowed to securely leave our luggages even after checking out.

I heard rumours that the hotel chain is known for prostitution and it feels very real when you are there - there is even a seperate hidden entrance/exit that makes entering/leaving very easy. It is a good and safe choice for budget tourists, but it does feel like you are in the sketchy neighbourhood of the city.
column9: The location is awesome and so close to both downtown metro stations. At night, you get a unique but very safe experience of the india neighbourhood, it feels very authentic compared to other parts of Singapore. I felt very safe.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• 2 rooms', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8:
The biggest problem is that, there is no toilet shower in the toilet. It was totally unexpected for us. The bathroom amenities is only the toothbrush and toothpaste. No soap, shampoo. However they say, the dispenser in the bathroom is multipurpose - works as both Soap & Shampoo !! .
The AC is centrally controlled. Whenever you need to change the temp., you need to call to the reception for that.
Rooms are not soundproofed at all. You can listen whenever someone walk through the corridor. Every time a door lock it makes a big sound, which is clearly audible, which was very problematic.
No room service.
No hotel staff to help with the luggage or anything.
column9:
The Bed size and cleanliness is OK. 
I have met with two receptionist. The male receptionist knows no formalities, did not behave properly. The female one - Min Hui - was helpful in finding attraction tickets and car for airport transfer.
They had luggage storing area.
Location is good for restaurants and MRT.

column6: “The hotel was nice and clean, and had decent staff.”

column8: The Standard double rooms did not have any windows for Ventilation. They were just rooms with good Airconditioning. The rooms can just fit 2 Adults  in a Large bed. We were a family of 4 (2 Adults and 2 kids - 16 and 9 years) and had to book 2 rooms for 7 days, since they were the only ones available. I would suggest to book rooms with Windows if the option is available.
column9: The Locality was excellent. Just a 2 - 5 minutes walk from Jelan Bazar & Rocher MRT stations. Also about 7 minutes walk from Little India MRT station. It was surrounded by many Eateries which offered Indian as well as Local food at much affordable rates. Also very close to a lot of Shopping and Dining activity on Serangoon road on one side and Bencoolen St on the other.  We would start venturing out at 8:30 am and return back after sight seeing at 9:30 PM. So the Rooms were just sufficient for our purpose.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']

column9: Staff pleasent, location was handy to town and train stations.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Superior Twin Room', '• Stayed 11 nights']
column8:
Our flight to Singapore was cancelled and I SENT THEM A MESSAGE VIA BOOKING.COM kindly asking them to keep our room until we got on the next flight, but we did not get any response in two days. Two days later, on the day of our rebooked flight, I called from Switzerland (4mins/15€) just to be told that our room wasn't available, and that if we wanted to get a no-window room!? When we finally arrived, two stony faces received us at reception. They gave us a proper room without a fight, but forced us to pay the whole amount of money, as if nothing had happened!
We're disappointed with their way of working. Sometimes we saw 6 people at reception and how on earth no one dared to check my message on booking.com?! If they work with booking.com they should check on their updates on a daily basis. In some countries they would compensate you for all the bother and phone bill we had to go through to supposedly have a "wonderful stay"!
Moreover, they allowed us to check-out until 13.00hrs instead of 11.00h but by 12.00h they called to remind us that we had to leave!? Besides, every weekend there was such a fuss and noise along the corridors that we couldn't sleep! Last but not least, room was too small for two people and the hot water wasn't very hot at all and easily turning from cool to cold!
We would not recommend this hotel to any of our friends, family or colleagues! It was an experience we don't want anybody to go through!
column9: The location in the Little India district is good as there's a metro station next to it, and within 10-15 mins walking distance from the centre of Singapore and Arabic district. Wi-Fi and Air-Con are good. Besides, they always leave you a small bottle of water in room.

column6: “NO COMMENTS for hotel but i love SINGAPORE”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: room are very small and no windows . bathroom are not properly cleaned ... in short i dont like room and hotel smell ....
column9: area ... around the hotel was good and easy approach to mrt and bus stations .. and 24 hours open restaurants are 100m far only.

Great location, with heaps of restaurants close by. On the bus route, and with the new tram service running it will be easy to get to, with a short walk from the tram or bus stop.

column6: “The hotel is literally within 2 minutes walking distance...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 8 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Most of the rooms don’t have windows. So without the lights on the room feels pretty much like a grave. So if you are claustrophobic this hotel might not be a great idea. The cleanliness is not quite great. You will find hairs and dust in the corner after the housekeeping ‘swapped’ the room. There were cockroaches in our room but that was taken care of after we informed the front desk. You will not have remote for your room AC. The hotel is centrally Air Conditioned so every time you need to change your room temperature you have to call the reception
column9: The hotel is literally within 2 minutes walking distance from Jalan Besar MRT station, 4 minutes from Rochor MRT and Bus station, 10-15 minutes from Little India MRT and Farrer Park MRT station and Mustafa Centre. It’s within the famous Little India art belt. You can take a lazy walk to Sim Lim Square, Arab street, haji lane and back. You’ll have great and budget food centres around you. There is one Indian food centre and one Chinese food centre just in front of the hotel that are open 24 hours. And the stuff is super friendly and helpful (Except for one grumpy guy)

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: There were no Bidet shower for the commode.
column9: Bed was comfy. Cleanliness was good. House keeping was good. Good Service. We were able to keep our baggages before and after the checking in and check out times respectfully.

column6: “Good if you are on a budget ”

column8:

The corridors were quite noisy at night but we used ear plugs and it was fine.

the hotel near Jalan Besar MRT (downtown line) and lots of cheap restaurant nearby (open 23hours!)

I reported to receptionists who gave me another room which was cleaned and no smell. The motor with a high noise level in the bathroom made me restless through all night. Those online photos of the hotel look good, but it was not true. Also the area was depressing. I was wondering whether it would be worthy to stay there.
column9: The location near to MRT station and bus station was very near, so it was easy to travel to the downtown and the airport next day. I was given an extended check out time until 1pm.

column8: My room had cockroaches in it. I understand this is value for money property, but that does not justify the uncleanliness of the room and the bathroom. The bedsheets were not clean either. When I informed the reception of the insect situation, they offered me an alternate room but I had already unpacked by then and was also about to leave for an entire day of sightseeing. So the reception ensured me of doing a proper cleaning of the room. I don’t know what they did, but it did not work and the cockroaches were still present in the room. I love Singapore and I will visit again, but I will not be staying at this property the next time.
column9: The reason for my second stay was because of the convenient location of the hotel. Rochor and Jalan Besar MRT stations are within 5 minutes walking distance. Mustafa Centre is a 10 minute walk.

column6: “Not suitable for families and not a pleasant experience”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8:
The booking at this hotel was done well in advance. At the time of booking, I wrote to them to request early check in. I did not get any response. On the day when we arrived, we were told an extra $68 per room would be applicable. We had no choice as we had just arrived in the country and wanted to rest. So overall it turned out to be expensive.
Rooms have no windows. Bathrooms have moulds.
A slightest sound in the corridor is clearly heard in the room.
Not suitable for families.
Even if you stay for 3 days, the room is not cleaned unless you specificially request it.
column9: On the check out day, they allowed us to keep our luggage to afternoon. This was great service considering the negative experience we had at this property.

column8:
The room was smelling like mould, the bathroom have one wall made of glass so if you go toilet in the night and put on the light all the room become bright and the fan in it is very loud likely we have ear plugs.
Also you cannot Controll the aircon so the room is usually freezing and if you want to change that you need to call every time the reception and they will do it for you (boring)...

Of course NO breakfast included but at least you get instant tea and coffee in the room every day with a little bottle of water. 
Also cheap room = no windows so very hard to know how is the weather outside..

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8:
I've read the review on this site beforehand, so I came to prepare the worst. Which actually not worst, our experience was quite fine. 
The bathroom, just like the others have said. They didn't separate the shower with the toilet, so it got wet everywhere after you took a shower. 
The room was small, but very decent with the value of money in Singapore. They have no windows though, be careful if you're claustrophobic.
The wall is kind of thin, we could hear when our neighbors came late and bang their doors at wee hours.
You gotta call the reception to change the temperature in the room, it gets cold at night because the room is so small.
column9:
The location is seriously no joke. 
The hotel is super near with Jalan Besar MRT Station. It makes convenient when you take the train from/to the airport. Rochor Station is also nearby, it's only two mins walk I guess. Don't forget the bus stops that are very reachable. A lot of food stalls nearby, you could walk a little and find Bencoolen Street, where there are more cafes and food stations. 
It's also near Bugis street, Haji Lane, Lavender area; you could actually walk there when the weather is really good.
The check in process was very quick, staffs were helpful. Check out process was also the same. We left our luggage after we check out because our flight was at night, and the concierge lady was extremely nice and kind. I didn't get to see her name, but she asked how our trip went by. I am touched :)
Also, the cleaning lady. Even though she's not really good in English, but she's very thoughtful to give us extra towels.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: It is a cheaper hotel in Singapore but it is basic (no window - no fridge in the room). But this is clear when you book so not a negative point.
column9:
The location is good. Close to the metro, a lot of (mostly Indian) restaurants and also a 7eleven.
Check-in was without a smile but other staffs were more friendly.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Twin Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column9: Room a bit spartan, but ok. Annoying thing with the air condition. Had told the receptionist to turn  it off. But if you remove  the door key from the holder or just leave the room the a/c automatically gets turned on again. I had to get up in the middle of the night to tell the receptionist to turn it off again.

- the hotel isn't sound proofed and so we heard people talking late at night and making noise when we were trying to sleep.
column9: We really liked staying in Little India, it's a really vibrant area and the hotel is situated quite close to Little India metro. The room is basic but a good size and clean. All of the usual amenities are provided (coffee, tea etc) along with two bottles of mineral water. The hotel is quite basic but is a place to lay your head and good if you intend to spend most of your time sightseeing.

Very very basic rooms. Photos look nicer than it actually is!

On my last night the manager asked if I wanted to switch rooms, which I declined as I couldn’t be bothered to pack just for one night. The children had disappeared that night and it was quiet.
column9:
WiFi was excellent and worked all around hotel. The staff did help with everything I needed but didn’t smile much. I had an issue with the noise from other guests and they offered to move rooms. 
The location was great for the price of the hotel. Close to many shops, eateries, convenience stores and Bugis Street. It was around the corner from the metro which was only 3 stops to ‘bayfront’. Nearby the bus stop for the city hop on bus

column7: ['• Business trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Usually Singapore hotels have comment about window if they don't have window. This one didn't have a comment. When I got there, I realized that their standard rooms don't have window. The room had disgusting moldy smell. So I upgraded room with additional 10dollars. The window room didn't have moldy smell but terribly cold. You cannot change the temperature of AC in your room. I asked to reduce AC to the reception but nothing changed. And the reception woman showed us very Singaporean hospitality(means no eye contact, no smile, no greeting, almost throw away my credit card and ID, expedite to move fast...). What a happy trip.

Two things:
1. It's not soundproof. You will hear babies cry from another room, children shouting non-stop and people blasting music but it is 97% of the time very quiet.
2. Twice, the housekeepers/cleaners rang my bell despite my Do Not Disturb sign. I panicked as I was naked. Once, I was not in the room but I had my Do Not Disturb sign outside, I came back and found out my room was opened and cleaned. I had to reorganise my stuff because he/she put all of them on the floor (without any damage, though).
column9:
-The staff members are friendly and helpful.

-Good location. Less than 3-minute walk to the nearest MRT station, 7-Eleven, other convenience stores, good local restaurants/pubs and barbershops (great for head massage).
-There's a vending machine outside of the hotel.

column9:
Amazing location. Close to 3 tube stops and the downtown line that will take you to all of the sights. You can get the tube pretty straightforwardly to the airport. Little India is great especially for budget travellers like us as it’s less expensive than the rest of Singapore. If you stay here, eat at the hawkers market at the tekka centre round the corner the food was incredible.
It was super clean, offered free bag storage after check out and great WiFi.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: The only area for improvement I can think of is the central AC regulation. If you wish to turn off the AC for the night, you need to call the reception. Not a big deal, but it would be nice to have AC in your own control :-).
column9: Honestly I think this is the best low budget choice for a 3-night stay in Singapore. Located in Little India neighbourhood, this hotel is a perfect base for exploring this fascinating city. Rochor MRT is just 3min away and Little India MRT is 10min away, so you can't beat the location. The double room without a window was rather basic, but it was very clean (towels and bedding were changed everyday) and all we needed was a decent and inexpensive place to sleep. There are fantastic Indian eateries in the area such as Komala Vilas where you can taste authentic Indian dishes for a price close to nothing. Not to mention countless stalls with fresh veggies and Indian spices. Hotel staff was friendly and courteous, wifi worked well. All in all, a great experience.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8: Had a 3 day layover in Singapore to rest and work from my room. Stayed on the ground floor. A large group of people were also booked on the same floor. The noise from these group people in the hallways kept me awake with doors continuously slamming against stoppers in latches and people chatting outside my room. My worst stay in a hotel room for a long time. Wont be back.

column6: “Not as described, not worth the money, and definitely won't be back.”
column7: ['• Group', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 5 nights']
column8:
Have been using booking for years, and I don't normally leave reviews (especially never a negative review), but this time is too bad experience to not leave a review, so other people is aware of what they are getting. 
Standard Room has NO WINDOW, which was not stated during booking. First room was HUMID with strong MOULD SMELL, so spoke to staff straight away after checking the room, and was given a few other rooms to look. ROOM WITH WINDOW is less humid with less mould smell, however it will COST EXTRA. All other rooms are just as bad, so had to stay in the same room for the first night.
With the ROOM CONDITION mentioned above, both mum and I COULDN'T SLEEP AT ALL even after 8 hours long flight. So again talked to the staff next morning, and was finally given a room less humid and with less smell (no window with no extra charge), was then able to sleep for the next 4 nights... 
Be mindful of what you getting!  (With similar price or a little bit extra, you can get a hotel in much better condition)

column6: “Other than one gripe the Hotel 81 Dickson fulfilled expectations and requirements.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8: There being no power connection near the head of the bed. There were several in one place above a small table at the other end of the room. However, an essential piece of medical equipment to facilitate sleep could not be connected as the power connection outlets were too far away. A staff member at reception was asked if the hotel could provide an extension power cord to rectify the issue but even though he knew the purpose of the request he rather dismissively said the hotel had no extension power cord. Really? That's hard to believe. There was no need to forewarn the hotel as every accommodation I've stayed in around the world, be it 1-star or 5-star, always had a power connection outlet near the head of the bed. At the very least, guests would want to recharge their cellphone and have it close to them while sleeping in the event of having to respond to a call or text message.
